cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi–Alabama) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast between Grand Isle, LA and the Alabama/Florida border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Grand Isle LA to AL/FL border; Tropical Storm Watch: AL/FL border to Ochlockonee River FL; Storm-Surge Watch mouth of Mississippi River to AL/FL border, including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: greatest impacts expected along the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast LA, MS, AL, far western FL Panhandle)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east-northeast winds 25–35 mph with isolated tropical-storm-force gusts possible Saturday, diminishing overnight
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inch totals could cause minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along Atlantic beaches
